description: Housing sales fell year on year for 11 straight months. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: China's property market shows early signs of stabilising
title_page: China's property market shows early signs of stabilising | The Straits Times
maintext:
BEIJING - China's embattled property market is showing early signs of stabilising, after months of plunging sales following a government clampdown on over-leveraged developers two years ago.
Sales across the country's top 100 developers rose 61.2 per cent last month to 733 billion yuan (S$153 billion), according to data from property consultancy China Real Estate Information Corp.
